title: Boundaries Like Coastlines

panel_structure.description: The Architect as chemist examining pulsing cell membranes under magnification. Selective permeability visualized as conversationsâ€”molecules being welcomed, rejected, or released. Evan observes the living filter.

Cell membrane morphs into coastline with fog lifting and settling. Tidal movements show boundaries expanding and contracting. Evan stands in the intertidal zone where water meets land, neither fully one nor the other.

transformation_notes: This scene brilliantly uses biological and geographic metaphors to reconceptualize boundaries not as walls but as intelligent, responsive interfaces. The tidal metaphor liberates us from fixed boundary thinking.
dialogue_rhythm: From scientific observation to poetic integration
narrator_role: Guide through the wisdom of permeable boundaries
